p: Assuming, as I have proposed elsewhere [ [1], [2], [3]], that there is no epidemiologic science before the end of the 17th century, this is a brief retrospective of catastrophic pandemics since the 17th century, that is, the plague in the 17th century, cholera in the 19th century, tuberculosis and influenza in the early 20th century, and HIV/AIDS in the 1980s.
